alert.note: Alert for District of Columbia (District of Columbia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 03 at 12:52AM EDT until July 03 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central District of Columbia... Northern Prince Georges County in central Maryland... * Until 400 AM EDT. * At 1252 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen, with higher totals just upstream. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bowie... New Carrollton... College Park... Greenbelt... Langley Park... Beltsville... Bladensburg... University of Maryland... Fort Totten... Gallaudet University... Howard University... Laurel... Fairland... Landover... Hyattsville... White Oak... Takoma Park... East Riverdale... Adelphi... This includes the following Flood Prone Roads: Rhode Island Ave NE between 2nd and Capitol... Beach Dr from Broad Branch Rd to Piney Branch Pkwy... Route 1 at Ritz Way... Right lanes of US 50 just west of exit 13... Contee Road at Bear Branch... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
